Mandāravapūjaka Thera：An arahant．In the time of Sikhī Buddha he was a devaputta，and offered the Buddha some mandārava flowers，which remained like a canopy over the Buddha’s head for seven days．

Ten kappas ago he was a king named Jutindhara （Ap．i．178）．

He is probably identical with Usabha Thera．ThagA．i．219．
